title: Screaming Trump supporter ‘jokes’ that eating babies will stop the climate crisis
text:
A woman reportedly affiliated with the LaRouche PAC, a right wing group that supports Donald Trump, shouted that the only way to save the climate is to eat babies at a Democratic town hall meeting (Picture: C-SPAN)

A woman reportedly affiliated with a far-right political group shouted that eating babies is the only way to stop climate change.

The bizarre rant was caught on camera at a town hall meeting in New York City on Thursday where Democratic Congresswoman Alexandria Ocasio-Cortez was speaking.

An unidentified woman wearing a shirt that read ‘Save the Planet, Eat the Children’ stood up trolled Ocasio-Cortez for her proposal of the Green New Deal. The deal is an ambitious plan to combat climate change in just ten years that Ocasio-Cortez and other Democrats have previously touted.

She shouted: ‘I think your next campaign slogan has to be this: We have got to start eating babies…I’m so happy that you are really supporting a Green New Deal, but it’s not enough.’

‘Even if we were to bomb Russia, we still have too many people, too much pollution. So we have to get rid of the babies. That’s a big problem. Just stopping having babies is not enough. We need to eat the babies,’ she continued.

It was us. Malthusianism isn't new, Jonathan Swift knew that. Sometimes, only satire works. https://t.co/vR8oXdx39i — Lyndon LaRouche PAC (@larouchepac) October 4, 2019

LaRouche PAC, a pro-Donald Trump fringe group, has since taken credit for the stunt. It was reportedly intended to be satire that mirrored Jonathan Swift’s tongue in cheek essay ‘A Modest Proposal,’ which suggested the Irish should sell their babies for food to combat poverty and unfair trade relations with Great Britain in 1729.

The group later tweeted: ‘It was us. Malthusianism isn’t new, Jonathan Swift knew that. Sometimes, only satire works.’

Malthusianism is an idea that asserts population growth is exponential while food supply growth is linear, meaning the population can increase too rapidly for the food supply to keep up.

Ocasio-Cortez can be heard trying to calm to woman down by saying ‘It’s ok,’ while completely ignoring the comment about infantile cannibalism.

Donald Trump commented on the video on Thursday night, tweeting: ‘AOC is a Wack Job!’ Although it is unlikely that the president was aware of the LaRouche group’s involvement.

Ocasio-Cortez tried to diffuse the situation, but did not acknowledge the woman’s claims about the benefits of eating babies. (Picture: C-SPAN)

The LaRouche PAC, which believes climate change is a hoax, has been promoting the ‘eat children’ satirical message to discredit the environmental advocacy movement.

They posted photos on Facebook on Wednesday of LaRouche PAC members who they said were ‘challenging students with a polemical campaign, “Eat the Children,”…to reduce the planet’s population one child at a time!’
description: The bizarre rant was caught on camera at a town hall meeting in New York City on Thursday where AOC was speaking on Thursday.
